module.description: Integrated module which includes the PKA K

register.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
When set to '1', indicates that an EIP201 AIC is included in the EIP150
When set to '1', indicates that the EIP76 TRNG is included in the EIP150
When set to '1', indicates that the EIP28 PKA is included in the EIP150
When set to '1', indicates that the EIP150 is equipped with a AXI interface
When set to '1', indicates that AHB interface is asynchronous Only applicable when AHB_INTERFACE is 1
When set to '1', indicates that the EIP150 is equipped with a AHB interface
When set to '1', indicates that the EIP150 is equipped with a PLB interface

register.description: PKA hardware revision register This register allows the host access to the hardware revision number of the PKA engine for software driver matching and diagnostic purposes. It is always located at the highest address in the access space of the module and contains an encoding of the EIP number (with its complement as signature) for recognition of the hardware module.

bitfield.description: These bits should be ignored on read
These bits encode the major version number for this module
These bits encode the minor version number for this module
These bits encode the hardware patch level for this module they start at value 0 on the first release
These bits simply contain the complement of bits [7:0], used by a driver to ascertain that the EIP150 revision register is indeed read
These bits encode the AuthenTec EIP number for the EIP150
